title: Custodian Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Willis, OK)
Interview Descriptions: One persons, in a shop, very easy process. Position was to clean college dorm rooms., with other responsibilities. Mowing, maintenance, and occasionally helping wit my certain class expeditions. Very beautiful property, just our in the middle of no where so expect a drive to work.
Interview Questions: The hardest question was how much can you lift

title: Wellness Coach Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was formalized, organized, and mostly virtual. I appreciated the process they had in place. I interviewed with several of the team members and they each allowed time for me to ask questions.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oklahoma
Interview Descriptions: Pretty easy. Basic questions, talked out my experiences, one round of interviews of only 30 minutes on zoom. I heard back in March, and had only 3 people interview me, and they were all great.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself and that was

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Received a response on my application within 24 hours. The first interview was over Zoom with a panel of 4 and the final interview in person with another panel of 4.
Interview Questions: Sometimes when meeting with another team, we don’t understand everything about that their role or responsibility. What have you done to learn about the functions of another team so that you can best determine how to collaborate with them?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oklahoma
Interview Descriptions: I first sent my resume and waited for about a month for a call back. Then I got interviewed by the Assistant of the Associate Dean. I was told they'll make a decision within two week which I did.
Interview Questions: I got asked question about how I would handle certain team conflicts and office situations. I was asked if I knew how to transfer calls and how I would sort files and student papers.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oklahoma
Interview Descriptions: Hour-long interview with senior members of the team, on questions both technical and qualitative relating to data science within atmospheric science. Indeed, it kept one on one's toes as they juggled from topic to topic, with a friendly awareness of the positive energy emanating from the professionals on the call.
Interview Questions: What model would you use to predict a given weather hazard, and why.

title: HR Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: Great communication pre-interview. Group interview after initial screen with manager of department. Very conversational. Brief tour of office. Personal follow-up after interview to see if there were any questions. Had one main contact person during the entire process who was very helpful.
Interview Questions: How have you dealt with difficult situation?

title: Community Engagement Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: 1 initial interview over Zoom and a 2nd 4 hour interview in person. Interviewed with a committee of people, got a tour of the office, got coffee with some people in the office for a more informal way of getting to know me.
Interview Questions: Why would you be a good fit for this position?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oklahoma
Interview Descriptions: Simple if you know the professor or have been in their class. They may ask some major-specific or technical questions but, if you do well in your field, it should be no problem.
Interview Questions: What do you want to do in the future? Why do you like energy?

title: Honors College Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oklahoma
Interview Descriptions: Group interview, usually 2-5 people per group. panel of interviewers, each ask 1-2 questions. 30 minutes. Ask questions like “if you could personalize your own tour to show your best friend around that has never seen campus, what’s the one stop you wouldn’t want to miss?”
Interview Questions: What is your OU Story?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oklahoma
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with existing tutors and leadership at the student learning center for a tutoring position. Was asked about my teaching methods and areas of expertise. Very pleasant and informal conversation.
Interview Questions: Have you heard of the Socratic method?

title: Athletic Marketing Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Was very informative, and professional. Interviewers had a lot of knowledge on conversation topics. They made it comfortable and a fun experience. This was key in helping me open up, and express my qualities in regards to this position .
Interview Questions: What are some of your leadership skills?

title: IT Services Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oklahoma
Interview Descriptions: Typical simple first round questions concerncing soft skills.  It centered on personnel management questions.  They had 5 or 6 people asking a question or two each those were not difficult.
Interview Questions: Discribe a difficult situation that you faced from disagreeing with an employee.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Asking about background. Interest in field. The questions they asked: What kind of background do you have in the research study? What is your interest in the field? Over all pleasant experience. Interview process likely dependent on the interviewer
Interview Questions: What kind of background do you have in the reserach study? What is your interest in the field?

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Oklahoma City, OK) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: One technical review. Algorithm level easy-medium. Don’t remember exact algo but if you can do medium level algorithms you should do be able to do it. The other parts of the interview were behavioral.
Interview Questions: What is your history in engineering.

title: Digital Media Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oklahoma
Interview Descriptions: You do a Phone interview first. If they like you  then you schedule a zoom call with a panel of 5 people who will decide if you get the job.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you would be a good fit for this job?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Applied for software developer and had one interview with directors. The application is online and it took a few months for them to set up the interview. After an interview, they offered the position the next day.
Interview Questions: What is Docker and how much experience you have? Describe Git and its functionality.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: As a student, it was super welcoming and fun. I didnt feel nervous at all even though it was a group interview. Really recommend to any student to apply to be an assistant
Interview Questions: If you had all the money in the world, what would you buy?

title: PhD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma
Interview Descriptions: It was simple and not too bad. I nenjoyed it and they asked the basic questions but you know how it is. You just try and make it work you feel messages
Interview Questions: What is your Interest in our program?

title: Information Technology Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK)
Interview Descriptions: One in-person or virtual interview with the student teams' supervisor. When applying to the job, it is important to follow all of the directions for the application (including submitting a cover letter). If they make an offer, it will usually come within a week.
Interview Questions: Q: How would you explain wifi to a retiree?

title: Community Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oklahoma
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very straightforward. A lot of the questions had to deal with working as a team and working beside others.  A lot of the job deals with customer service, so there was an emphasis on how you would deal with a difficult customer or resident.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had a conflict with someone and how it was resolved.

title: Program Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Applied to jobs.ou.edu and received contact within two weeks. Over zoom, three interviewers, asked regular questions over zoom to satisfy requirements. Interview lasted 30 minutes with questions from each interviewer.
Interview Questions: How do you organize yourself?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Oklahoma City, OK) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: My interview process was very relaxed and informative. Did not feel tense at all. Everyone was warm and attentive.  It was a one-step interview process with everyone present at it.
Interview Questions: What will you propose we change on our report?

title: Program Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oklahoma
Interview Descriptions: There was a short phone interview followed by in person. The final meeting was a panel interview with three members of the staff including the Director.  The was asked to write a short example of case note.
Interview Questions: How is your experience helpful to department?

title: Office of Admissions Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was easy, fast and comfortable. The interviewers did a great job engaging with me and the questions were not too difficult. One of the more painless interviews I have ever had.
Interview Questions: What customer experience do you have?

title: Tour Guide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was just one round of interviews. Was a mix of behavioral and situational questions that pertained to the job. It was also a panel interview which was nice because it gave the questions variation.
Interview Questions: Name a time you used leadership to solve a problem.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oklahoma
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and approachable people. It was nice to be able to walk on campus and interview in the department offices. I was able to get walk to the office building on campus.
Interview Questions: What do I expect to get out of the job?

title: Emerging Technologies Librarian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Oklahoma City, OK) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews.  The second interview includes a job talk. Most questions from faculty are about the presentation topic. The second interview has five meetings: presentation, with dean, with faculty + staff (2 meetings), and with the search committee
Interview Questions: How would you apply the technology you talked about in your presentation to XX field?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oklahoma
Interview Descriptions: They asked me if I wanted to be a tutor and I said yes to it.  You will want to discard this review because I am only doing it so that I can see more information on other jobs.
Interview Questions: Have you experience in physics and math?

title: Fabrication Lab Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma
Interview Descriptions: Online student jobs site may have delayed response times overall not too strenuous of a process more feedback along the way would have been preferred however. Appreciative of no hire notices by email
Interview Questions: Experience using software and more

title: New Nurse Graduate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma
Interview Descriptions: The interview was set up and the times were all wrong. The recruiter didn't seem to communicate correctly. The interview was very rushed and disorganized. They said they were going to call me for a follow up interview/call but that did not happen.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why we should hire you

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: apply job position throughout the official website, then candidate will receive email either invite to interview or not, then the interview process is either throughout the zoom or team. or in person interview, Normally the candidate will have interview with more then 2 team members in the trams
Interview Questions: how did you release your stress

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: I got an email for a zoom interview and then was contacted for the second interview. I have not heard back yet. I expect an email by this week. It was a quick process .
Interview Questions: What is a time you were unintentionally hurt someone?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma
Interview Descriptions: Nothing much required THROUGH THE COLLEGE. Tution fees are really high for the facilities we get. Please don't except what you pay for.Tution fees are really high for the facilities we get.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: IT Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview was excellent with a personal touch. The company ensured that their goals and mine aligned. The team was very amiable and friendly. I will definitely recommend that job to anyone in the school
Interview Questions: Tell me about to yourself

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Received phone call within 4 weeks to set up interview. Interview was with project lead and department director with the project lead asking the most questions. Atmosphere was comfortable. Received follow-up call with job offer within 1 week.
Interview Questions: Describe past experience in data gathering and management.

title: Library Circulation Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very simple, it seemed it was pretty much already decided I just had to prove I was normal.  Not much to say. I submitted my resume, they called me, I walked in and they told me what I needed to do.
Interview Questions: Have you ever worked in a library before?

title: CFI Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: First, you have to apply online through jobs.ou.edu. Then you receive and email with your interview time and day. I walked in to a panel of Assistant Chiefs and interviewed.
Interview Questions: What was a hard time you had to overcome?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Oklahoma City, OK) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: 50% behavioral questions and 50% clinical questions. Interviewing group can include a nurse manager, supervisor, charge , and APRNs. Overall climate of the process is calm, and non-intimidating but be sure to come prepared and be ready to admit your lack of knowledge but have the willingness to learn and be trained.
Interview Questions: What recent conflict have you experienced in your previous unit?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oklahoma
Interview Descriptions: Scheduled for the phone interview through email. Then gave me a call on time. Asked about education background. Then explained the requirement of the position. The whole process was easy because there are not a lot of competitors for the position. It's much easier than a business interview.
Interview Questions: When will you be available for the position

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Tulsa, OK) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was started with very warm greetings and then they asked question about my education and work experience and also my future goal . Overall it was very friendly and it went smoothly
Interview Questions: What was your action in your past employment situation?

title: Legal Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: I had two interviews and they were seamless. I had been a nanny for my interviewer and that is how I heard about the job. I ended up getting the job. I think my interview experiance was unique, because I already knew my interviewer.
Interview Questions: They asked how  i handeled situations

title: Laboratory Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Oklahoma City, OK) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted directly by my would be supervisor within about two weeks after applying. I was asked a few open ended questions about my past experience and future goals. I ended up asking most of the questions, and they were quite plainly very busy and rushed but still polite.
Interview Questions: I was asked to summarize past research experience.

title: Student Athlete Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process requires one in person meeting. It is held in the academics office and lasts about 30 minutes. It was very casual and did not require much effort. They ask you simple interview questions.
Interview Questions: Why would you be a good fit for this job?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: took the English exam and got interviewed by several teachers from different department about my teaching experience and research experience, what preparation I had for the TA position? whether I'm eligible for a lab or just for grading based on my personality and social skills
Interview Questions: Do you think you are qualified for a TA position?

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took about 2.5 weeks and each interview lasted 30 min or longer. The first typically is an interview panel and the second is more in depth about your 5 year plan or passion about higher ed.
Interview Questions: What are challenges faced in Higher Education?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: The application is online for the "Graduate Recruitment Weekend". You apply for the GA positions you want. You could get selected for all that you apply for, or just a few. OU creates your interview schedule and then you interview with the different departments needing GAs.
Interview Questions: Normal situation interview questions

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Straight Forward Interview. Lasted about an hour. The interview panel included my future supervisor and two senior academics advisors. The questions that were asked were pretty basic and although I prepped for the interview I would have been fine had I not.
Interview Questions:
Name a time you helped a student overcome a challenge.

How do you create work / life balance?

title: Post-Doctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Easy going. Very professional and knowledgeable . 
Skype interviews with previous  research backgrounds
Onsite interview.
They ask me to tell me about yourself. Why do you want to work here? what is your long-term career goal
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself.
Tell me when you disagree

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oklahoma
Interview Descriptions: the interview was arranged by the secretary and the full procedure just follows an ordinary interview that one may expect. There was not specific tough questions, since this is not a very competitive position.
Interview Questions: job related questions

title: IT Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview was brief. They set up a time to speak to me by phone. Being in the IT field for years, I was told through the IT network they had a in house person in mind.
Interview Questions: Typical IT support questions.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma
Interview Descriptions: Hiring depends on how well a students skill is fit for research in a particular lab. It is also subjective to the availability of funds with the professor. All the best
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with the professor?

title: Groundskeeper Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Filled out application online.  Then submitted resume, followed by phone interview ,then personal interview(s).  I was scheduled to meet with hiring committee but I decline because I had accepted another position
Interview Questions: Why i was interested in changing careers

title: Director of Development Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma
Interview Descriptions: Skype interview and then a day and a half long interview process a month later.  It was a 3 month long process. They decided to not fill the position.
Interview Questions: Describe your prospect process

title: Media Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very light and easy. Not intimidating at all. They wanted me to be there and made me feel welcome. They asked fun easy questions and I enjoyed the overall experience. Great starter interview practice
Interview Questions: 30 seconds to write a descriptive idea about coffee. They did it as well

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Spoke with head of department asked if opening in any area. It was very causal and took only a small amount of time. Having a "people-personality" is a plus. Need to be flexible on time and hours to find the best fit.
Interview Questions: Asked what my availability was and years of experience. Along with PGA and investment interest.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Took part in a Graduate Recruitment Weekend and was interviewed individually by multiple possible employers on campus in one day.  They were all similar in their processes. They lasted about 45 minutes and gaged my past job experiences and campus involvement. I received offers or rejections within the month.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult experience in your past and how you handled it?

title: Job Location Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Student position--must be currently enrolled.  Single interview with department head and manager of behavioral questions. Must provide a resume, cover letter, and class schedule for the following semester, but a transcript is not needed.
Interview Questions: What have you learned from your most recent leadership experience?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oklahoma
Interview Descriptions: The interview was 20 min phone interview with the search committee members. There was an introduction of the committee members and each member gave me 1-2 question about my research and teaching experience.
Interview Questions: I got 4-5 questions about research interest and teaching experience.

title: Staff Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK)
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position and within about 45 days I was offered a job and I accepted. I only had to do one interview so the interview process wasn't horrible. I was really shocked that I was offered the position since how my past experiences didn't include anything that they was looking but they saw that I had the potential to learn anything that was handed to me.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK)
Interview Descriptions: After having been accepted into the University's Graduate College, I was offered an interview with one of the department's professors who was seeking a graduate research assistant. Talked about why I would like to be involved with academics and research and what a potential research project would look like.
Interview Questions: What brings you back into the academic world?

title: Food Handler Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and takes about two weeks to get approved. The only thing you need to upload is transcript and time schedule. Easily approved and easily applied. No interview
Interview Questions: N/A

title: SWAT Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK)
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed. They are looking for very responsible students. SWAT workers typically work in dean's offices or department offices such as the English Department or CAS Dean's office, thus it is often only through suggestion of other SWAT worker students that you can get an interview for a position with SWAT. Because an interview typically requires being referred by an existing SWAT worker, the interview for SWAT is typically very relaxed. They just want to get to know you, so just be yourself.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Water Safety Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: The person hiring me had known me personally for years prior, so the interview itself was somewhat informal. I sat in their office, gave them my resume and certifications, and answered a few questions. At the end they asked me what day I could start, gave me a few contracts to sign, and explained how to sign up for the when to work app so that I could be assigned hours.
Interview Questions: How many hours a week can you work?

title: Buildng Official Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: excellent interview, excellent management, very friendly, allowed to myself, talked openly about future with OU and opportunities ahead.   job tasks, responsibilities, continuing education, my intentions as the building official , my outlook at OU.
Interview Questions: my job details, intentions

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: they let me selected a time to interview in person. there has 3-5 team members to interview you. they asked some expriences  questions , behavior questions. very friendly conversition.
Interview Questions: "tell me about yourself"

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: It begins with interviews with faculties regarding our research backgrounds. Then I gave an hour presentation about my research topic to faculties and students in the department. Then I have met with the department chair regarding the role of the position I applied.
Interview Questions: What are my main research area and my future plans?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Skype phone call, asked about previous research experience as well as what research I am interested in. Heard from supervisor the next day that I had received the position, which is nice.
Interview Questions: Previous research experience

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK)
Interview Descriptions: Pretty easy going. Met with two of the employees and they asked typical interview questions. Most of the questions were either about your personality or skills. They also wanted to know a little about your involvement at school.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Circulation Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was an easy one. I had the supervisor of the department interviewing me. The interviewer was mostly interested whether i could work certain shifts. I also gave brief introduction about my self (name, major and why i was interested in the job). It was short straightforward interview.
Interview Questions: Can you work night shifts?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: uptight , boring , would never work here again, get out of oklahoma as fast as you can. full of prentious arrogant people. go to dallas. this place sucks just get out fast get alll the way out ... leave leave leave
Interview Questions: strengths and weaknesses

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma
Interview Descriptions: Had an interview with one other person, four interviewees. Each asked a question. Very relaxed environment, were looking for someone good with technology as well as someone who was friendly and willing to talk to people!
Interview Questions: What is your favorite program?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma
Interview Descriptions: He read my resume and asked me some basic questions. Then he gave me one topic to do as the class project. At the end of the semester. I showed him the results of the project. Then he accepted me as his RA
Interview Questions: What are your technical skills?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma
Interview Descriptions: I already had been working as an undergraduate research assistant, so this wasn't really an interview per se. I did meet with the people I was collaborating with, which was okay if a little confusing as the details of the actual project were vague. Also, things were a little different as we already had funding to carry out the project, so the interview was more of a meeting.
Interview Questions: What are your technical skills?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma
Interview Descriptions: I was scheduled for an interview within 2 weeks of applying.  The interviewing panel consisted of the entire Admin office, including the Director of the dept. They were very nice and casual through the process.  I wore business casual and they did too.  The interview took place in their conference room, so it was private where students or professors passing by couldn't interrupt.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my previous on-campus job profiles, my available hours, computer knowledge and office supplies inventory management experience.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: They asked for the algorithm questions (about two basic algorithm questions)and technical problems. And then we talked about the previous projects and some behavioral questions. The whole interview would last for about an hour.
Interview Questions: Talk abbot your previous project?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Oklahoma City, OK) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: One on One with follow-up group interview. Basically everyone in the office was there to ask questions. Intimidating sitting on one side of a conference table, facing the entire office: Administrative assistants all the way to the big bosses.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict?

title: Account Executive Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: 1 interview asking general behavioral questions along with a few questions about sales and the sales process. I am just writing words now because this glassdoor page will not let me leave without filing out at least 50 words. The interview was very straightforward. they just wanted to make sure that I was able to socialize and sell
Interview Questions: sells us x item

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was introduced to a professor through another professor teaching there. Then I went to his office and he asked me couple of questions about my skills and my experience and that was it
Interview Questions: DO you know SolidWorks

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: There was an one time on-site interview. I was notified over email regarding the time and location of the interview. The interview was average in terms of difficulty. They asked about my expertise and skills. Also asked about my future plan. Fortunately they were looking for similar skill set I have. So I got an offer letter on the next day of the interview.
Interview Questions: What fabrication skills do you have?

title: Managerial Associate I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and relaxed.  Group was easy to talk to and was courteous.  Round robin of questions from each person in the room.  Asked both supervisory and general questions. Interview lasted about 45 minutes.
Interview Questions: How do you handle a disgruntled employee

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Standard questions about research, teaching, publications, future projects, why I want the position in front of 5-6 people over Skype. Campus visit also standard with campus tours, meet and greets with students.
Interview Questions: What are your future research plaans

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: SKYPE INTERVIEW, I applyed  for an special job fair, i could not be at the fair because I live abroad, but they were great, i talked to them about my interest in the job and they decided to make an skype interview
Interview Questions: QUESTIONS ABOUT MY EXPERIENCE, AND THE WAY I REACT IN DIFFERENT SITUATIONS, ALSO THEY ASKED ME ABOUT MY BACKGROWND IN FINANCE.

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: the interview process was very simple and easy at the university of oklahoma. The staff was very nice and each person I met truly wanted you to succeed in life. I interviewed a few days after submitting an application online. The interview was straight to the point and was not very intimidating. They did ask personal questions, but those were non-invasive. Overall a very good experience.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in drug discovery research?

title: Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview, very laid back. After being hired I had a couple of days to get the paper work filled out. Then I came in on a Sunday for a training day. During the training they will go through pretend calls just so that the new callers will have a good idea of what to expect.
Interview Questions: How much money do you feel comfortable asking alumni for?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received an interview a week later. Once I acceptance the position my supervisor was very flexible with scheduling my work time so it did not conflict with my class schedule. There was a minimum of 10 hours or a max of 30 hours that a student could work.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience doing repetitive tasks?

title: Program Specialist I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma
Interview Descriptions: The interview was with a panel of three people.  They each took turns asking questions.  It was a pretty relaxed interview.
Interview Questions: All of the questions were pretty common.  "Why do you want to work here" always gets me.

title: Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Only one interview, great! Friendly and comfortable environment. Accepted the position a few days later. Would have loved to stay at the job for even longer if I was not graduating from college. Highly recommend this company and the people that work there. Love love love.
Interview Questions: What do you enjoy about print design?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: There was not an interview process to apply for the University position so i didn't have to pass through the process of being interviewed. Again, I did not apply for an interview with my current employer
Interview Questions: The did not ask anything since there was no interview to begin with. I just applied online in the University website and got selected to pursue my degree based on my credentials

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma
Interview Descriptions: I was called for an interview, and the people seemed really nice. However, they were looking for someone everyone could bond with and I came off a little to professional and straight forward.
Interview Questions: Nothing out of the ordinary, really easy interview actually if you fit the enviroment

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Heard about an open position from a friend that works there. Went to make inquiries and i was told to send my resume to the recruitment manager. My resume was reviewed and i was told to resume work after the nature of the job was explained to me.
Interview Questions: Was asked about my major and why I decided to major in that field.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: You send the application materials including CV, writing samples, and recommendation letters, get screened for phone interview, and then invited for campus visit/interview. Campus interview takes two nights, and you give an hour long presentation about your research and teaching. You also meet all faculty and grad students who will be asking formal and informal questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Cashier/Facility Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very casual and informal, with oral one-on-one questions in a supervisor's office, mainly focusing on relevant experience and familiarity with the job position and responsibilities in the facility. (GlassDoor won't let me list the correct interview date; it was November 2010, not 2013.)
Interview Questions: I believe one question was, "If a disgruntled customer/member came up to you complaining about a particular piece of equipment being out of order or unavailable, how would you resolve the situation?"

title: IT Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma
Interview Descriptions: Onsite interview. Some general questions at the beginning, then hands on a computer to work on several technical problems.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oklahoma
Interview Descriptions: Talk with the professor whose research areas you are interested in
Interview Questions: Depend on the research areas and professors.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oklahoma
Interview Descriptions: Interview consisted of meeting before a board of advisors, usually between three and six people.  Were very interested in learning about past experience and contributions made to better former companies. Very responsive to commentary and questions regarding objectives and goals. Clear communication and straight forward with job requirements and duties.
Interview Questions: What do you think you can bring to the company and how do you plan on implementing future goals?

title: Student Athlete Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was really quick and easy - nothing too formal and nothing tricky at all. They just ask you about yourself, your school work, and anything related to tutoring. They'll ask you which subjects you feel comfortable tutoring in, and other questions like that. The hiring and interview process should not be a worry.
Interview Questions: They were all easy, but be prepared to answer why you should be tutoring for whatever subject you're trying to tutor in.

title: Staff Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was very smooth. It was with several people and they were very nice.  They were also informative about the job and they made the job interview process to where you didn't feel like you were on the spot to make you feel nervous.
Interview Questions: What I wanted to do with my life after I received my bachelor's degree?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back, I didn't really have to do much to convince them to hire me. They are always looking for new tutors, since most graduate after four years. It is an excellent starting job and one of the best at the University.
Interview Questions: How do you describe yourself?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Was flown to the campus for the interview.  Spent the day with grad students and stayed in a little hotel room on campus.  Met with one of the professors for about 30 minutes before lunch.
Interview Questions: Asked about research experience.

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma
Interview Descriptions: It went well. I thought it wouldn't go well, but it did go well. I was surprised they didn't ask any question that much.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult question.

title: University Libraries - Access Services Student Employee Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: I arrived, sat down with the staff supervisor and a student supervisor, and essentially just chatted about my resume items: past employment, major, extracurriculars, etc. The supervisor for this department is an incredibly nice lady, if a bit weird, and the interview was very "her," I realized once I'd been there a while.
Interview Questions: What was the hardest thing you had to do at your last job? (Seriously, this interview was super basic.)

title: Kitchen Crew Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online they called me saying I got the job, that was it.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Marketing/PR Specialist I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my resume, was offered a short preliminary interview followed by a half day second interview. The process is time consuming and can last several weeks. The interview itself was not difficult though.
Interview Questions: What are you currently reading?

title: IT Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: You need to know people in the panel. The interviews are about who you know and not much about what you know. They have set list of questions and all depends on how you impress the panel with your attitude. If you are applying for tech position, there is no correlations between Job description and actual job you end up doing.
Interview Questions: You need to know people in the panel. The interviews are about who you know and not much about what you know. They have set list of questions and all depends on how you impress the panel with your attitude. If you are applying for tech position, there is no correlations between Job description and actual job you end up doing.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions:
The University required the reading and processing of a 40 page RFP document.
A proposal and bid, under very specific guidelines, then needed to be assembled and submitted.
Interview Questions:
Absorbing and responding to a 40 page RPF. 
Assembling and mailing a detailed RPF response and proposal for production under very specific, detailed and restrictive guidelines.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Stillwater, OK) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty tough, was asked a bunch of questions about what my favorite cereals were and other delicious breakfast pastries. Of course, I told them I loved crepes. I mean, who doesn't they are the most delicious item on any menu.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Assistant Professor and Later Department Chair Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: typical academic interview, which included a job talk, various meetings with constituents in the department, a meeting with the associate dean, teaching a sample class, and touring campus; meals with various constituents.
Interview Questions: will vary according to discipline

title: Art Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions:
The process was initially very positive. I was contacted for an interview only days after submitting an online application. They were very friendly and showed they were interested in selling the job to me. The people I met and interviewed seemed very professional. I was asked to prepare a presentation of my portfolio, but they seemed not to have enough time to be interested in that when I got there. 

After the interview, they asked me to perform an art test, which is odd, since my portfolio pretty much shows what I can do and art tests are typically used earlier in the process, well before interviews as a filter. It was a short test, and I submitted the results on time. I then heard nothing for weeks. 

I finally sent an email to the hiring manager who notified me they had already sent notice that they hired someone else... VIA SNAIL-MAIL... through the correspondence dept at a huge university! Are you kidding? All other communications were either by phone or email. The manager said they had immediately sent out the mail, but after receiving the letter, I checked the post mark and noted that it was post-marked ten days after he said it was mailed. Good grief. MAJOR FAIL!

It's fine to be rejected. It's really no big deal, but being on the bubble for a job that could mean a major move for you and your family is stressful in a big way, especially when you know you are one of two finalists for the position. It is the height of unprofessional behavior to let that go on for weeks after making a decision, because you were either too embarrassed, busy, or lazy to assure prompt notification to other candidates waiting to hear from you.
Interview Questions: There were no real odd questions.

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was told about the position by one of the people I went to high school with. They mainly wanted to know how well I had done in my previous classes. The interview was low-stress and I was apparently overdressed, but my supervisor has been really great to work with
Interview Questions: Most of the questions were mainly about my schedule and my previous experiences as a tutor. No curve balls here.

title: IT Student Employee Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Applied via jobs.ou.edu, received a phone call and agreed to meet at the office. 3 managers asked about previous experience, other jobs held, and then asked a few scenario based questions relevant to the work expected.
Interview Questions: A customer brings in a computer and their display is not working what are the first three things you would check?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Emailed the professor I wanted to work describing my interest in the field and my credentials. Got a call from the professor after 2 weeks. Asked me few questions. Then, asked me apply for graduate research assistantship along with my PhD admission application.
Interview Questions: Asked few basic questions on the research I would be doing.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Tulsa, OK) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: The process was very well given in advance so that I had ample of time to prepare for them. They are not difficult and much of the process is done based on your resume. The interview is a two tier interview where by they have the department chair interview you first then they have specific HR personalize interview you later.
Interview Questions: Where do you see your research go

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Batavia, IL) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: in academia you are better of by contacting the employer directly through networking at conferences or meetings or by email or phone. You employers are usually aware of your need for employment through management and disseminate the vacancy information through management, once they know about you, you can get an interview, if you are a member of their existing collaboration you may continue working within it, if you are a new person, they may interview you on site, everything else is the same as everywhere else
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: First, you need to pass the GRE exam.  Then before the deadline, you apply through the graduate application website of OU. Then send your CV, recommendation letters, personal statement, academic transcript to  both graduate college and the department.  Then you just wait.  Someone will give you an email and set up a time for a telephone interview.
Interview Questions: None. Most professional questions

title: Chemistry TA Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Jul 2009
Interview Descriptions: The Chemistry Department needed more Chemistry Teaching Assistants so I decided to apply. Within a few days I received a call for an interview with the head of the Chemistry Department. The interview was your basic 1:1 interview where he asked me about my credentials. He also asked me about which labs I would prefer to teach and a couple of days later I was told that I got the position for the lab that I wanted. I would recommend that you apply early because positions are limited.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Editor Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Oklahoma (Norman, OK) in Apr 2008
Interview Descriptions: Submit a written application, have a newsroom vote, interview with the Publications Board
Interview Questions: How will you handle conflict?
